ai.question: Which four statements are true regarding distance vector routing protocols? (Choose four.)

choice.text: Hop counts can be used for path selection.
Routing updates are broadcast at intervals.
EIGRP can do unequal-cost load balancing.
RIP sends its entire routing table to directly connected neighbors.

ai.question: Which conditions cause distant vector routing protocols to send routing table updates? (Choose three.)

choice.text: when the hold down timer expires
when a change occurs in the network topology
when the update timer value expires
when a triggered update is received from another router
when a packet is received that is destined for an unknown network
when there have been no routing table changes for 30 minutes

ai.question: What are two characteristics of EIGRP updates? (Choose two.)

choice.text: only triggered for route topology changes
bounded to affected next hop routers

ai.question: What feature was added to RIP to help with synchronization errors?
Which two of the following are timers used for RIP?
Which statement is true concerning the advantages of a distance vector protocol?

choice.text: convergence times make routing loops impossible
ease of implementation makes configuration simple
they work well in complex networks
their convergence times are faster than link state routing protocols

ai.question: Which mechanism can be used to avoid a count to infinity loop?
Refer to the exhibit. The network shown is running the RIP routing protocol. What mechanism will keep Router4 from sending updates about the 10.0.0.0 network back to Router5?
What allows distance vector protocols to avoid routing loops by advertising a metric of infinity?

choice.text: time to live (TTL) field of IP header

ai.question: Which field in the IP header ensures that packets will not loop endlessly on a network?
